title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2022 that cover various aspects of misinformation, fake news detection, media stance detection, and related topics
**"The Spread of True and False News Online"** by Soroush Vosoughi
This study analyzes the spread of true and false news stories on Twitter, highlighting the faster and broader dissemination of false news
**"Fake News Detection on Social Media: A Data Mining Perspective"** by Kai Shu, Amy Sliva, Suhang Wang
A comprehensive review of data mining techniques for detecting fake news on social media platforms
Fundamental Theories, Detection Methods, and Opportunities"** by Kai Shu

**"Detecting Fake News on Social Media: An Overview"** by Kai Shu, Huan Liu, and others
container-title: Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Web and Social Media

title: An overview of the challenges and methodologies in detecting fake news on social media
**"The Science of Fake News"**
A discussion on the scientific understanding of fake news and strategies to combat it
**"Emergence of Scaling in Random Networks"** by Albert-László Barabási and Réka Albert
While not directly about misinformation, this foundational paper on network theory is crucial for understanding information spread
**"The Role of the Media in the Internet Era: Mass Communication and the Online World"** by Matthew Gentzkow
An exploration of how the internet has transformed media consumption and the implications for misinformation
**"Combating Fake News: A Survey on Identification and Mitigation Techniques"** by Kai Shu, Suhang Wang

title: A survey of techniques for identifying and mitigating fake news
An examination of how social media can create echo chambers that reinforce misinformation
**"Media Bias in the Marketplace: Theory"** by Sendhil Mullainathan and Andrei Shleifer
A theoretical framework for understanding media bias in competitive markets
**"The Filter Bubble: What the Internet is Hiding from You"** by Eli Pariser
Although a book, this work is seminal in understanding how algorithms can create personalized information bubbles
People Believe What They Want to Believe When it Makes No Sense at All"** by Gordon Pennycook and David G
A study on the cognitive biases that lead people to believe fake news
**"The Political Economy of Mass Media"** by Andrea Prat and David Strömberg
An analysis of the economic forces shaping media content and its political implications
**"The Role of Social Media in the Arab Spring"**
A case study on how social media can both spread information and misinformation during political upheavals
**"The Effects of Fake News on Political Attitudes and Behavior"** by Andrew Guess
An exploration of how fake news influences political beliefs and actions
**"Media Bias and the Influence of the Media on Political Outcomes"** by Stefano DellaVigna and Ethan Kaplan
A study on the impact of media bias on political outcomes
**"The Role of Social Media in the Fake News Phenomenon"** by Hunt Allcott and Matthew Gentzkow
An analysis of how social media platforms contribute to the spread of fake news
